MODULE.name: KeyState
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: The KeyState API is used to display small icons to the user indicating the current shifted state of the hardware keyboard. The KeyState indicator will display icons for Shift, Alt, Control, Function, Caps, Num lock and Orange key states, growing from the right as necessry if more than one key state is set at once. This API is only supported on a subset of Motorola Solutions' Windows Mobile / CE / Embedded handheld devices (see remarks).

METHOD.name: showStates
METHOD.APPLIES: Only available on Motorola Solutions' Windows Mobile / CE / Embedded handheld devices.
METHOD.DESC: Display keystate icons representing the shifted state of the hardware keyboard.

PARAM.name: propertyMap
PARAM.DESC: The properties associated with the keystate indicator, its size and position.

PARAM.name: right
PARAM.default: [Keystate Indicators start at the bottom right of the screen]
PARAM.DESC: The absolute horizontal position of the keystate indicators in pixels. This is the rightmost edge of the rightmost indicator, where multiple indicators are displayed simultaneously they will grow from right to left.

PARAM.name: top
PARAM.default: [Keystate Indicators start at the bottom right of the screen]
PARAM.DESC: The absolute vertical position of the keystate indicators in pixels.

PARAM.name: width
PARAM.default: [A sensible width based on Screen Resolution]
PARAM.DESC: The width of each keystate indicator in pixels.

PARAM.name: height
PARAM.default: [A sensible height based on Screen Resolution]
PARAM.DESC: The width of each keystate indicator in pixels.

CAN_BE_NIL.DESC: Not specifying any properties will display the keystate indicators at the bottom right hand corner of the screen.

METHOD.name: hideStates
METHOD.APPLIES: Only available on Windows Mobile / CE / Embedded handheld devices.
METHOD.DESC: Stops showing keystate icons representing the shifted state of the hardware keyboard.

REMARK.title: Devices lacking support
REMARK.DESC:
Due to platform limitations this API is not available on the following Motorola Solutions' devices:
- ES400 - MC45 - MC65 - VC70

REMARK.title: Screen Orientation
REMARK.DESC: The indicator positions are absolute and so when rotating the screen you should also move the indicator positions accordingly to accommodate the new screen layout.
